page.title: 16LANDSCAPE OF ERPINGHAM
page.content: Here is how a boy describes the landscape as viewed from school. "The land slopes gently away to the curving horizon.The meadowlands curve upweards then down making the land look hilly and lopsided.Young green shoots of grass and flowers grow in the tilted pastures wheresheep and cows eat the young shoots and make milk for their young to suckle. The river runs by winding its way through the fields.Houses are dotted over the land hiding behind trees and small woods.The sky is filled with fluffy white,cotton wool clouds which move slowly away.Church towers look over the landscape unchanged for hundreds of years."
